thread.title: Top Hat Hires Chief Revenue Officer John Hood to Scale the EdTech Startup’s Next Phase of Rapid Growth

author: cnbc.com
title: Top Hat Hires Chief Revenue Officer John Hood to Scale the EdTech Startup’s Next Phase of Rapid Growth
text:
Former Sales leader at Oracle, HP, and Dell brings proven track record for leading high-performing teams and delivering predictable revenue growth
Top Hat’s platform is used by thousands of professors and millions of students at 750 top universities and colleges in North America, including Indiana University, The Ohio State University, and the University of Massachusetts
TORONTO--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Top Hat , provider of the leading cloud-based teaching platform for higher education, today announced that John Hood has joined the company as Chief Revenue Officer. Hood will oversee all revenue-generating functions, including Inside Sales, Enterprise Sales, and Customer Success. He will serve as a member of Top Hat’s executive team and report directly to CEO and co-founder Mike Silagadze.
“Our mission at Top Hat is to improve the university experience by empowering educators with the tools and content they need to engage their students and help them succeed,” said Silagadze. “We’ve enjoyed tremendous growth over the past five years and have no intention of slowing down. John’s deep experience building and scaling high-performing sales organizations at some of the largest software companies in the world will accelerate our ability to bring that mission to life.”
Hood joins Top Hat from Oracle, where he was the Group Vice President in Sales Development & Demand Generation for Oracle Digital, and led a team of more than 800 sales professionals. Prior to that, he was the Chief Revenue Officer at Auction.com , where he steered high-impact sales, sales operations, and support teams. Previously, Hood was Vice President and General Manager at HP, where he was responsible for the Americas SMB market and increased U.S. market share by 13 points in three years. He began his career with Dell, where he spent 17 years in a variety of sales, operations, and general management roles in the U.S. and internationally, helping Dell grow from $900 million to more than $60 billion in annual revenues.
“What attracted me to Top Hat was the company’s unique vision for transforming the way educators teach and students learn,” said Hood. “The company has already enjoyed impressive growth and has attracted a world-class leadership team. I’m excited to bring my 26 years of experience building and scaling sales organizations in the U.S. and around the world to help the company reach new heights.”
About Top Hat
Top Hat’s interactive, cloud-based teaching platform enables professors to engage students inside and outside the classroom with compelling content, tools and activities. Millions of students at 750 leading North American colleges and universities use the Top Hat teaching platform. To learn more, visit https://tophat.com/ .
